intro: Erigeron mihianus, commonly known as blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its blue to lavender-colored flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Erigeron mihianus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
